comp3111.data.model

Class Tour

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3111.data.model.Tour

  • @Entity
public class Tour
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Tour in the database. There are two types of tours, LIMITED_TOUR_TYPE and REPEATING_TOUR_TYPE. LIMITED_TOUR_TYPE type tours may only have offerings on getAllowedDates(), whereas REPEATING_TOUR_TYPE type tours may only have offerings on getAllowedDaysOfWeek().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tour

        public Tour()

      • Tour

        public Tour(java.lang.String tourName,
            java.lang.String description,
            int days,
            double childDiscount,
            double toddlerDiscount,
            int weekdayPrice,
            int weekendPrice)
        Constructs a transient Tour object, which is not child-friendly.
        Parameters:
        tourName - The name of the tour
        description - The user-facing description of the tour, which can at most be 255 characters long
        days - The duration of every offering associated with this tour.
        childDiscount - A double between [0, 1.0] indicating the discount for children. 1.0 for no discount.
        toddlerDiscount - A double between [0, 1.0] indicating the discount for toddlers. 1.0 for no discount.
        weekdayPrice - The dollar weekday price. Offerings for this tour created on weekdays will use this price.
        weekendPrice - The dollar weekend price. Offerings for this tour created on weekends will use this price.

      • Tour

        public Tour(java.lang.String tourName,
            java.lang.String description,
            int days,
            double childDiscount,
            double toddlerDiscount,
            int weekdayPrice,
            int weekendPrice,
            boolean isChildFriendly)
        Constructs a transient Tour object.
        Parameters:
        tourName - The name of the tour
        description - The user-facing description of the tour, which can at most be 255 characters long
        days - The duration of every offering associated with this tour.
        childDiscount - A double between [0, 1.0] indicating the discount for children. 1.0 for no discount.
        toddlerDiscount - A double between [0, 1.0] indicating the discount for toddlers. 1.0 for no discount.
        weekdayPrice - The dollar weekday price. Offerings for this tour created on weekdays will use this price.
        weekendPrice - The dollar weekend price. Offeirngs for this tour created on weekends will use this price.
        isChildFriendly - Whether or not this Tour is child friendly. Not used for any constraints checking. Only used for making recommendations to customers.

      • getAllowedDaysOfWeek

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> getAllowedDaysOfWeek()
        Returns:
        A collection of integers representing on which days of the week offerings may be created for this tour. Follows the convention of java.util.Calendar.
        See Also:
        Utils.dayToString(int), Utils.integerSetToStringDayNameSet(Collection)

      • setAllowedDaysOfWeek

        public void setAllowedDaysOfWeek(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> allowedDaysOfWeek)
        Sets the days of week on which this tour may have offerings. If this value is set (with a non-empty collection), then the tour type is assumed to be REPEATING_TOUR_TYPE. Therefore, do not call setAllowedDates(Collection), which is for LIMITED_TOUR_TYPE type tours.
        Parameters:
        allowedDaysOfWeek - A collection of integers representing on which days of the week offerings may be created for this tour. Follows the convention of java.util.Calendar.

      • getAllowedDates

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.Date> getAllowedDates()
        Returns:
        A collection of dates representing on which actual dates offerings may be created for this tour.

      • setAllowedDates

        public void setAllowedDates(java.util.Collection<java.util.Date> allowedDates)
        Sets the actual dates on which this tour may have offerings. If this value is set (with a non-empty collection), then the tour type is assumed to be LIMITED_TOUR_TYPE. Therefore, do not call setAllowedDaysOfWeek(Collection) which is for REPEATING_TOUR_TYPE type tours.
        Parameters:
        allowedDates - A collection of integers representing on which days of the week offerings may be created for this tour. Follows the convention of java.util.Calendar.

      • getChildDiscount

        public double getChildDiscount()
        Returns:
        A double between [0, 1.0]. 1.0 indicates full price (no discount).

      • setChildDiscount

        public void setChildDiscount(double childDiscount)

      • isChildFriendly

        public boolean isChildFriendly()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the tour is child friendly. Is not used for any strict enforcing, but only as suggestions to customers when they ask for recommendations.

      • setChildFriendly

        public void setChildFriendly(boolean isChildFriendly)
        Parameters:
        isChildFriendly - Whether or not the tour is child friendly. Is not used for any strict enforcing, but only as suggestions to customers when they ask for recommendations.

      • getOfferingAvailability

        public java.lang.String getOfferingAvailability()
        Returns:
        A nicely formatted string representing the dates or days of the week on which offerings may be created for this tour. If this is a LIMITED_TOUR_TYPE tour, then the function returns a collection of dates. Otherwise if it is a REPEATING_TOUR_TYPE, it returns a collection of integers representing the days of the week.
